# Reference-Style Links

## Basic Reference Links

This is [an example][example] reference-style link.

You can also use [numbers][1] for link references.

Or use the [link text itself] as the reference.

[example]: http://example.com/ "Example Site"
[1]: http://example.org/
[link text itself]: http://example.net/

## Multiple References to Same Link

The [Markdown][md] syntax was created by [John Gruber][jg].
You can read the [Markdown][md] documentation online.

[md]: https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/
[jg]: https://daringfireball.net/

## Angle Bracket URLs

Here's a link with [angle brackets][angle].

[angle]: <http://example.com/path/with spaces>

## Multi-line Definitions

Check out this [long link][long].

[long]: http://example.com/very/long/path/to/resource "Title on next line"

## Implicit Link Names

Visit [Google][] for search.
Check [GitHub][] for code.

[Google]: https://google.com/
[GitHub]: https://github.com/

## Case Insensitivity

These should all work: [Link A][ref], [Link B][REF], [Link C][Ref]

[ref]: http://example.com/
